pageContext.claim: “Previous presidents have used their national emergency power to promote democratic elections in Belarus, to ensure political stability in Burundi and to defend the sovereignty of Lebanon. … But we need it right here in our country.”
pageContext.analysis: No president has declared a national emergency to seek funding for a policy priority -- in this case, a border wall -- that Congress declined to approve. The constitution says the president and Congress must agree before any funds are appropriated for specific projects, and it will likely be up to the courts to decide whether his emergency declaration is constitutional.
